tasks.name: Apply Glassmorphism Effect to Transparent Popup
tasks.description: Modify the CSS for `.lucid-transparent-popup` to include a backdrop-filter for a glassmorphism effect, matching the style of `.lucid-tooltip-detail`.
tasks.implementationGuide:
1. Open `src/styles/global/essential.css`.
2. Locate the `.lucid-transparent-popup` CSS rule.
3. Replace its `background` property with `background: var(--lucid-bg-glass-primary);`.
4. Add the `backdrop-filter: var(--lucid-blur-md);` and `-webkit-backdrop-filter: var(--lucid-blur-md);` properties to the rule.
tasks.verificationCriteria: After rebuilding and reloading the extension, the transparent popup should have a blurred, glass-like background, identical to the tool-popup.
tasks.summary: Successfully applied glassmorphism effect to the transparent popup by updating its CSS properties to match the existing toolpopup style. The change was a direct application of established design tokens (`--lucid-bg-glass-primary`, `--lucid-blur-md`), ensuring UI consistency.
